text: (6/6) Most importantly, we must stop the hard left extremists in the Labour Party from winning power - and I believe @Jeremy_Hunt is best placed to undertake that task. Let‚Äôs #UniteToWin.

text: (5/6) As we move forward with delivering Brexit we must unite our party and our country around a wider agenda, address the division in our society and provide sensible, responsible government.

text: (4/6) As such, deal-making is part of his DNA - and that is the great challenge before us. We must send a strong message to the EU that we want a deal ‚Äî but crucially, make clear that we are also willing to walk away without one. @Jeremy_Hunt gets that.

users.name: Dr Liam Fox MP

text: (3/6) Jeremy is a successful entrepreneur and instinctively understands the needs of the businesses we all rely on to deliver prosperity.

users.name: Dr Liam Fox MP

text: (2/6) Throughout his career, Jeremy has a track record of achievement and he has impressed me during his time in Cabinet as Culture Secretary, Health Secretary and as an outstanding Foreign Secretary.

users.description: Member of Parliament for North Somerset. International Trade Secretary (2016-19) & Defence Secretary (2010-11). Sponsor of the #DownSyndromeBill
users.name: Dr Liam Fox MP

text:
But it‚Äôs only responsible for us to prepare for all outcomes and that‚Äôs what government has been doing.
 
In event of no-deal, we have already secured agreements with countries that account for over a quarter of UK trade covered by EU trade agreements. https://t.co/Y7Gkd5W0YP
users.description: Member of Parliament for North Somerset. International Trade Secretary (2016-19) & Defence Secretary (2010-11). Sponsor of the #DownSyndromeBill
users.name: Dr Liam Fox MP

text:
However, there is only one way to guarantee we avoid disruption to trade after Brexit and that is by getting a deal with the EU.
 
This will secure our trade with the EU and with all of those countries covered by our existing agreements.
 
Deal explainer: https://t.co/5yMc3HqvUs
users.description: Member of Parliament for North Somerset. International Trade Secretary (2016-19) & Defence Secretary (2010-11). Sponsor of the #DownSyndromeBill
users.name: Dr Liam Fox MP

text:
For perspective, we have already signed some of the largest of these agreements including Switzerland which alone accounts for around 20% of trade with these countries.
 
The countries covered by the 20 smallest agreements count for just 0.8% of our total trade. https://t.co/GWfsmUJOKT
users.description: Member of Parliament for North Somerset. International Trade Secretary (2016-19) & Defence Secretary (2010-11). Sponsor of the #DownSyndromeBill
users.name: Dr Liam Fox MP

text:
But we do want to avoid any disruption to our trade with the EU and those countries we already have trade agreements with.
 
We are seeking to transition agreements that account for 11% of our total trade. https://t.co/X7X7y3dUg7
users.description: Member of Parliament for North Somerset. International Trade Secretary (2016-19) & Defence Secretary (2010-11). Sponsor of the #DownSyndromeBill
users.name: Dr Liam Fox MP

text:
The UK will carry on trading with the rest of the world whether we leave the EU with or without a deal.
 
Nearly 40% of our current trade is not covered by existing EU agreements. https://t.co/pUCNhesOID

text: (2/2) The best way to avoid no deal is to vote for the Prime Minister's deal.  I support and voted for the PM's deal, I hope others take a pragmatic approach too.
